title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner features two dozen indie bands over a two-day event.
Boston.com photographer Ben Stas captured performances by bands like The Hotelier, Teen Suicide, and Angel Du$t.
Day 1 performances included Her New Knife, February, Momma, and Explosions in the Sky at the Boston venue.

title: Patriots fullback Jack Westover says his sister bet Super Bowl LX matchup in training camp
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Jack Westover's sister placed a $5 bet on a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX matchup during training camp.
The bet paid out $18,000 after the Patriots and Seahawks became AFC and NFC champions.
Westover, a former University of Washington player, joined the Patriots practice squad in 2024 and became a regular in 2025.

title: Watch: Mike Vrabel and Drake Maye address crowd at Patriots’ send-off rally
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel spoke at the Patriots' send-off rally in Foxborough on Sunday.
Maye, addressing fans, expressed gratitude and highlighted the team's ongoing Super Bowl journey.
Patriots will face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on February 8 at Levi's Stadium.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Alexander Skarsgård hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Alexander Skarsgård hosted the 1,000th episode of 'Saturday Night Live' on January 31, with Cardi B as musical guest.
The episode featured cameos by former 'SNL' star Pete Davidson and actor Stellan Skarsgård, Alexander's father.
Despite the milestone, the show maintained its regular format with sketches and Weekend Update, without special celebrations.

title: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald grew up in Scituate and dreamed of running the Red Sox
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald, originally from Scituate, Massachusetts, will face the Patriots in Super Bowl LX.
Macdonald once dreamed of being the Red Sox general manager before pursuing a career in football coaching.
Macdonald, 38, became Seahawks' head coach in 2024, achieving a 24-10 regular-season record and returning to the Super Bowl.

title: Watch: Patriots’ Super Bowl LX send-off rally
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Patriots held a Super Bowl send-off rally at Gillette Stadium with performances and speeches from team officials.
Team captains and figures like Robert Kraft and Mike Vrabel addressed fans before departing for California.
Patriots face the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on February 8th, entering as 4.5-point underdogs.

title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praised the New England Patriots' culture, encouraging free agents to consider joining the team this offseason.
The Patriots feature a Super Bowl appearance, respected coach Mike Vrabel, and a franchise quarterback, enhancing their appeal to free agents.
Top potential free agents for the Patriots include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips for the 2026 season.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal with the Patriots, establishing himself as a top defender.
Williams recorded 5.5 sacks in the regular season and postseason, contributing significantly to the team's Super Bowl run.
Included in the Patriots' top-10 best free-agent signings, Williams' performance ranks him eighth on the list.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics unlikely to make major moves before Thursday's NBA trade deadline, focusing on possible roster additions.
Potential trade targets include Nets' Nic Claxton, known for defensive skills, and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford.
Celtics also considering guards like Kings' Keon Ellis and centers like Pelicans' Yyves Missi for roster enhancement.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way Fest 2026 took place at Boston's Roadrunner, featuring indie and alternative rock bands.
Texas' Explosions in the Sky headlined with a 90-minute set of instrumental post-rock music utilizing atmospheric lighting.
Worcester's The Hotelier, known for their loyal New England fanbase, performed and expressed gratitude for the festival's organizers.
